abstract: Study published in journal Science cites 13,800-year-old mastodon rib with bone point lodged in it as evidence of settlers who arrived in North America before the Clovis people.
snippet: A mastodon rib prompted speculation in the late 1970s about pre-Clovis settlers. Now improved carbon dating technology has confirmed the fossil is 13,800 years old.
lead_paragraph: A mastodon rib prompted speculation in the late 1970s about pre-Clovis settlers. Now improved carbon dating technology has confirmed the fossil is 13,800 years old.

headline.main: A Big-Game Hunt by Early North Americans
headline.seo: Mastodon Hunt Adds to Evidence of Pre-Clovis Settlement
headline.print_headline: A Big-Game Hunt by Early North Americans
